name: Setiptiline
summary: Setiptiline is a tetracyclic antidepressant used in Japan for the treatment of depression and depressive symptoms.
description: Setiptiline is a tetracyclic antidepressant (TeCA) structurally related to mirtazapine, marketed in Japan under the brand name Tecipul. It is indicated for the treatment of major depressive disorder and related depressive states. Setiptiline acts primarily as a noradrenergic and specific serotonergic antidepressant (NaSSA), antagonizing central presynaptic alpha-2 adrenergic receptors to increase norepinephrine and serotonin release, while also blocking specific serotonin receptors (5-HT2, 5-HT3) and histamine H1 receptors. It is not approved in the United States or Europe.

contraindications: Hypersensitivity to setiptiline or formulation components
Concurrent or recent use of MAO inhibitors

sections.text: Antagonizes presynaptic alpha-2 adrenergic receptors to enhance norepinephrine and serotonin release; blocks 5-HT2 and 5-HT3 receptors to increase serotonergic neurotransmission through 5-HT1A receptors; potent H1 receptor antagonist contributing to sedative effects.

adult.oral: Typically initiated at 3 mg once daily at bedtime; may be increased gradually based on response and tolerability, up to 6–9 mg/day.

sections.text: Initial improvement may be observed within 1–2 weeks; full antidepressant effect typically requires 4–6 weeks.

other: May cause significant sedation; advise bedtime dosing
Use caution in patients with cardiovascular disease
Monitor for weight gain and metabolic changes
Risk of serotonin syndrome when combined with serotonergic drugs

sections.pregnancy: Insufficient human data; use only if potential benefit outweighs potential risk
sections.lactation: Unknown if excreted in breast milk; caution advised
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity to anticholinergic and sedative effects; use lower initial doses

sections.text: Gradually reduce dose over 1–2 weeks to avoid withdrawal symptoms or relapse.

items: Not approved outside Japan; availability limited
Pharmacology similar to mirtazapine but typically used at lower doses
Sedative effects may benefit depressed patients with insomnia

items.label: Japanese Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency (PMDA) - Setiptiline

seo.title: Setiptiline - Uses, Dosage, Side Effects, and Warnings
seo.description: Setiptiline is a tetracyclic antidepressant (NaSSA) used in Japan for depression. Learn about dosing, side effects, interactions, and monitoring.
